definition: growing profusely, the ordinary members of an organization (such as the enlisted soldiers of an army), assign a rank or rating to
details:
adjective
- growing profusely
= example: growing profusely
- conspicuously and outrageously bad or reprehensible
= synonyms: glaring, crying, egregious, flagrant, gross
- very fertile
- very offensive in smell or taste
= example: very offensive in smell or taste
- complete and without restriction or qualification
= synonyms: downright
noun
- the ordinary members of an organization (such as the enlisted soldiers of an army)
= example: the ordinary members of an organization (such as the enlisted soldiers of an army)
= synonyms: rank and file
- the body of members of an organization or group
= synonyms: membership
- a row or line of people, especially soldiers or police, standing abreast of one another
= example: a row or line of people, especially soldiers or police, standing abreast of one another
- position in a social hierarchy
= synonyms: social station, social status, social rank
- relative status
= example: relative status
verb
- assign a rank or rating to
= example: assign a rank or rating to
= synonyms: place
- take or have a position relative to others
= example: take or have a position relative to others
- take precedence or surpass others in rank
= synonyms: outrank
